item.title: [637/639] Boolean Help
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

if (command[0].equals("kbd")) {
    if (player.hasKBDABLE) {
        player.teleport(2272, 4684, 0);
    } else {
        player.sendMessage("Complete Belly of the Beast for this teleport.");
    }
}

^ This would work.

As for your actual compiler error: your KBDABLE boolean isn’t in your Settings class, it’s in your Player class, which is why the compiler can’t find it.

Read full topic

item.title: [637/639] Boolean Help
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

I am still learning this, so please excuse the noobiness xD
I am trying to make it where a player cannot use a command, unless they’ve unlocked it.
There are probably many different ways to do this, but I am using a boolean.

Here is my boolean statement in player.java

[code] public boolean KBDABLE = false;

public boolean hasKBDABLE() {
	return KBDABLE;
}[/code]

To make the boolean true for a player, I am using dialogue. here is my code for the dialogue to make the boolean true.

case 4051: if (player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.HITPOINTS) >= 99) { player.KBDABLE = true; } else { player.sendMessage("Talk to me when you have 99 hp to fight the KBD."); return false; }

I have had no issues with the above; however the one thing I keep trying to code and get errors for is the actual command.
In command.java

if (command[0].equals("kbd")) { if (!player.hasKBDABLE); player.teleport(2272, 4684, 0); } else { player.sendMessage("Complete Belly of the Beast for this teleport."); }

however I get this error…

src\org\dementhium\content\Commands.java:264: error: cannot find symbol if (!player.getSettings().KBDABLE); ^ symbol: variable KBDABLE location: class Settings 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
I’m not sure what to do to make this work, all help is greatly appreciated! thanks in advance!

Read full topic
